title: (x) A Midsummer Night's Dream - Bodoni Classico/Bodoni EF {Lex}
content:
[http://i9.photobucket.com/albums/a74/DjArcadian/nye2005.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20060518231756/http:/i9.photobucket.com/albums/a74/DjArcadian/nye2005.jpg)

Can anyone ID this font?

Thanks!
author: DjArcadian

comments.content: You have either a Didot or a Bodoni. I’d do a search at one of the typesellers like FontFont or MyType. Just type in Bodoni or Didot.
It looks like a condensed Bodoni or maybe vertically scaled

Based on the ‘g’, ‘s’, ‘t’, and ‘r’ I’d say it’s either [Bodoni Classico](http://web.archive.org/web/20060518231756/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/bodoni-classico/) or [Bodoni EF](http://web.archive.org/web/20060518231756/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/bodoni-ef/). Either way it’s slighlty [squooshed](http://web.archive.org/wiki/squooshed).

- Lex

Edit: Bodoni EF seems closer to me
squooshed, yes that’s the term I was looking for.
Thanks guys!!! I really appreciate the help!
